properties.name: Hiawatha Lake Park
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli   A park with a cool playground, wading pool, and lake for swimming. How can it get better? In the winter, there\'s an ice sheet and warming trailer with free skates (if you can find the right size...)

properties.name: Longfellow Grill
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli Neo-diner, with updated classics. The steak sandwich is great, especially with sweet potato fries with aioli. Also love the jackcakes (pancakes covered in granola and fruit)--better be hungry, though. Parking can be tough.

properties.name: Mega Pan Asian Grocery Store
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli THE one-stop shop for all Asian (I may have to qualify that and say southeast or east Asian) foods. Kind of confusing layout (and tucked back in a light industrial area) but great.

properties.name: Mexican sandwiches
properties.description: Posted by BroccoliGrilled Mexican sandwiches

properties.name: Minneapolis Central Library
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli Really impressive, welcoming building by Cesar Pelli. Plenty of room for kids, teens, adults. Good chance you\'ll find what you want--if not put it on hold. Bonus for train-obsessed kids: only a block from the Hiawatha Light Rail.

properties.name: Minneapolis Institute of Arts
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli   minneapolis mnArt, ancient to modern, from all over the world. The interactive computer stations are cool, and it has a kids space with funky toys on the first floor.

properties.name: Minnehaha Park
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli  See the Minnehaha Falls, and even walk along the creek below and see the geology (count the steps on the way up/down--it\'ll take your mind off how many there are). Read Longfellow\'s "Song of Hiawatha" at the circular monument. Great food at Sea Salt. Fun bluegrass festival Labor Day.

properties.name: Mt. Nokogiri Buddha
properties.description: Posted by BroccoliLargest stone buddha in the world, and really cool. However, a steep mountain wasn\'t the best place to take my girlfriend the day after she arrived in Japan (in the August heat, no less).

properties.name: Picnic Point
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli madison, wiLike the name says, great place for picnic, a stroll, or even swimming if you can handle the algae. Great view of the city.

properties.name: Powderhorn Park
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli    Powderhorn ParkAnother of Minneapolis\' urban parks. Walk around the lake, check out one of the playgrounds. Especially recommended for annual events like the May Day parade (see the wikipedia entry) and Art Fair (usually in August).

properties.name: Seward Coop
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli One of the many great food coops in the Twin Cities.

properties.name: Taibusa Misaki Park
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli  Gives an amazing view of the coast, Tokyo Bay, and Mt Fuji if you\'re lucky. Bit of a steep ride if you\'ve got a one-speed bike, tough.

properties.name: The Baker's Wife
properties.description: Posted by BroccoliAmazing pastries (especially the cherry danish and pear tart), great bread, jaw-dropping cakes. Oh, and did I mention it\'s *cheap*.
